show_title: GM Farcaster ep261 Wednesday June 25, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
Farcaster Spam Check 

Do you want to help a friend affected by the spam label?

Check if they have the label by going to Profile > Three Dots > About and look at the spam label. 

If it says "0 (likely to engage in spammy behavior)", then reply with their username.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep261 Wednesday June 25, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
Why am I here ? 

I just had a conversation on Farcaster with a guy, he asked me a question about tokens and I told him I honestly don‚Äôt know much about tokens or crypto. 

He responded by asking genuinely ‚Äúwhy am I on this app‚Äù

It made me think, I know nothing about crypto, I‚Äôm not involved with any of it, so really why am I here. 

The backstory is, my best friend @evanzsolomon told me about the platform. He has been supporting my content on LinkedIn and other social media, and he told me I gotta come join Farcaster. So I did!

That‚Äôs it, nothing too complicated. But now I‚Äôm here, so might as well learn about crypto !

show_title: GM Farcaster ep261 Wednesday June 25, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
Engagement is a Two Way Street


I‚Äôve seen a lot of chatter on the timeline that engagement has been weird for the past 2 weeks. 

We‚Äôve either all gotten worse at casting, the hype of ‚Äúpro‚Äù has worn off, or the team has been experimenting with the algorithm and we are staring to feel the effects. 

Maybe it‚Äôs a combo of all 3 and we need to take some action. 

1. Clean up who you follow
2. Change your Feed Setting to see All Replies for a week
3. Reply to every thoughtful comment & ignore low effort replies
4. Hack the recency bias in the algorithm
5. Turn on ‚ÄúSuper Follow‚Äù (notifications) for your favorite casters or friends you want to see more
6. Change up how, when, and where you cast
7. Audit your own profile (handy Dune query below)

1. Clean up who you follow

You can‚Äôt make people follow you or engage with you, but you can save your engagement for those who engage back. If you are being truly thoughtful and authentic and someone never replies to you (and you don‚Äôt have a spam label so you know they can see you!) then stop wasting your time and move on. People are busy, notifications are buggy, spam labels are real. But if someone ignores you, move on. Even a like is enough. If they give you zero interaction back, try someone else. 

Here‚Äôs a quick tool to see who is still around. 
Don‚Äôt follow spammy people. Save friends who are mislabeled as spam. 
https://recaster.org/tool/follow-checker

2. Change your Feed Setting to see All Replies for a week


Farcaster is now letting you decide how many replies you want to see. I encourage everyone to change this setting to all for at least a week. Many casters have been in the shadows and you can help them be visible again.  Some accounts are inundated by AI automated accounts and won‚Äôt be able to use this setting, but most people should be able to try this for at least a week. Block automated accounts liberally. Give real casters a chance. 

https://farcaster.xyz/v/0x1e17bba1


3. Reply to every thoughtful comment. Ignore low effort replies. 

If you want engagement you have to give it too.  You don‚Äôt have to be a reply guy if it‚Äôs not your thing, but if people are taking the time to engage with your casts, take the time to reply back to authentic thoughtful comments.  If someone is in broadcast only mode and never engages back, reevaluate why you are replying to them in the first place. Is their content amazing? Does it make your Farcaster experience better? 


4. Hack the recency bias in the algorithm. 


The algorithm really loves whoever you last interacted with. So if you haven‚Äôt seen someone in a while or they haven‚Äôt seen you in a while, you‚Äôve got to teach the algorithm what and more importantly WHO you want to see! If you let it decide for you, you won‚Äôt see the people you want to see the most. You‚Äôve got to force and train it. 


5. Turn on ‚ÄúSuper Follow‚Äù (notifications) for your favorite casters or friends you want to see more


Sometimes the algorithm doesn‚Äôt show you what you want to see and you have to force it. Turn on notifications for a few people for a week and interact with their casts more. This is a good hack to get the algorithm to show them to you more in the future, if it behaves. I‚Äôve had to keep them on for a handful of people who don‚Äôt cast often. The algorithm really likes when you cast daily. 

6. Change up how, when, and where you cast

Videos don‚Äôt do that great here. Neither do photos or mint frames along. While we may want to share our content this way, the algorithm doesn‚Äôt love it. This is a text based social network and that has to be respected. Add more text around your content and try more experiments with text based casts. 

A great cast may not do well if most people aren‚Äôt online. Try casting at different times and experiment. 

Channels can be your place to find your tribe. There are thousands. Look for channels with very active hosts. They may have notifications on for their channels and be more excited when you choose to cast there. You can‚Äôt get a spam label interacting inside of channels so it‚Äôs more welcoming to new folks who are still trying to find their way. 



7. Audit your own profile

You can use this Dune query to see how you cast. Put in your own FID and run it. Then compare it to some other casters that you admire and you think are doing well.  Comparison is the thief of joy, but benchmarking is the only way to truly figure out how you are doing in Farcasterland. 


https://www.dune.com/jkavithamahesh/farcasterprofile

html.ogSiteName: Recaster - A Farcaster Client that offers extensive UI controls and configuration.

cast.text:
We're simplifying how replies work on Farcaster.

When you open a conversation, you‚Äôll see replies from everyone who doesn't have a spam label. This is a big change from today, where we apply a lot more filtering by default. 

If you prefer more filtering, you can go to Settings > Feeds and set "Reply Filtering" to aggressive. This will only show from people you follow and algorithmic suggestions from Farcaster.

This only applies to casts that aren't in channels, since some channels have more rules around who can reply.  

h/t to @akshaan for the ship!

html.ogDescription: Dune is the all-in-one crypto data platform ‚Äî query with SQL, stream data via APIs & DataShare, and publish interactive dashboards across 100+ blockchains.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep261 Wednesday June 25, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
I hate to be the one to break to to all of you who don‚Äôt come to IRL Farcaster events, but someone needs to tell you the truth. 

1. On average, Farcasters are really tall.  Like seriously. Something is in the water. 

2. Farcasters are really good looking humans. It‚Äôs not like a normal crypto conference crowd. 

3. They are also really nice. 

It feels unfair to see so many triple threats walking around, but it is what it is.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep261 Wednesday June 25, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
Heatwave PSA from a Certified Hot Dog

New York, I hear you‚Äôre melting. As someone who lives in Arizona, where it‚Äôs legally ‚Äúsurface of the sun‚Äù from May to October, I‚Äôve got some survival tips:
	‚Ä¢	Hydrate. That means water or electrolytes. Not iced coffee. Not matcha. Not alcohol.
	‚Ä¢	Cold showers are a strength, not a weakness. They are your entire personality now.
	‚Ä¢	Monitor the UV index. If it‚Äôs high, wear sunscreen.
	‚Ä¢	The only cure for swamp ass is nudity. Choose wisely. (This is not legal advice.)
	‚Ä¢	Consider shoes outside. Pavement can burn your feet in seconds.
	‚Ä¢	The city may smell‚Ä¶ stronger than usual. Lean in. Enjoy it. For me.

And remember: I wear a fur coat 24/7 in the Sonoran Desert.
You‚Äôll survive. But you should absolutely stay inside between 11am and 4pm or you will, medically speaking, crisp‚Äîwhile also sweating.

Stay cool. Stay hydrated. And if you start panting, find shade immediately. üåû
